metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2451 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL Server 5.6.15 and earlier allows remote authenticated users to affect availability via unknown vectors related to Privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2451` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mysql-client-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-client-core-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-common-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-server-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-server-core-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-source-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-testsuite-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.16-1~exp1').
